IV. 
Rockefeller Center Project  
 
A. Project Background
The Rockefeller Center Project16 will create a UTEN that connects three large commercial
buildings in midtown Manhattan converting from steam heating to UTEN-connected heat pumps.
The UTEN will utilize clean recycled waste heat from a variety of sources (e.g., multiple building
systems, steam condensate) in the Rockefeller Center network of buildings, creating a waste heat
exchange “marketplace” between buildings with different ownership. This project will generate
learnings for future construction of UTENs among high-rise buildings in a dense urban
environment, while balancing multiple waste heat thermal resources.
